title: How to Manually Rewind a Cassette Tape

steps.title: Find a pen or pencil that, when looked at on its end, is in the shape of a hexagon or octagon (six or eight sided respectively, much like a stop sign).
steps.content: Find a pen or pencil that, when looked at on its end, is in the shape of a hexagon or octagon (six or eight sided respectively, much like a stop sign). The very common, clear, BIC pens are perfect. These steps will not work with a round pen that is able to roll smoothly off a table.

steps.title: Insert the pen through one of the cassette reel holes.
steps.content: Insert the pen through one of the cassette reel holes.

steps.title: Slowly rotate the reel, ensuring that the pen makes good contact with the spokes (it should if you chose the right kind of pen).
steps.content: Slowly rotate the reel, ensuring that the pen makes good contact with the spokes (it should if you chose the right kind of pen).

steps.title: Always rotate the top of the reel toward the center of the cassette.
steps.content: Always rotate the top of the reel toward the center of the cassette. In other words, if your pen is in the left reel-hole, rotate clockwise. If it is in the right reel-hole, rotate counter-clockwise.

steps.title: In no time at all, your tape will be rewound.
steps.content: In no time at all, your tape will be rewound.
